page.title: 01The Whiteadder Basin
page.content: The area lies on the north side of the Tweed valley. It is mainly undulat- ing, ranging in height from 98m to 259m. The highest point is Duns Law which overlooks the county town of Duns(pop 2200). The considerable area of woodland is used for shelter belts to stop the crops getting blown to bits and ruined. There is a whiteadder runs eastwards, and once powered Cumledge Mill. there is a nature reserve at the castle, and also there is a lake called Hen Poo. A number are employed on the estate. Others work in industries related to agriculture. There are 10 farms. They are mainly arable, growing cereals, vegetables & oilseed rape.Sheep & beef cattle are also reared.Duns itself acts as a shopping centre for the local area and provides services ffor the local agricultural community.
